sentence.Network_en: It's great to have you back. Congratulations are surely in order!
sentence.Network_cn: 你回来真是太好了，就等着向你道贺呢！

sentence.Network_en: I said congratulations and walked over to him and shook his hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 我向他表示祝贺，并走过去和他握手。

entry.def: You say 'Congratulations' to someone in order to congratulate them on something nice that has happened to them or something good that they have done.

example.ex: Congratulations, you have a healthy baby boy...
example.tran: 恭喜，你生了个健康的男孩。
祝贺你写出这么有意思的文章。

entry.def: If you offer someone your congratulations, you congratulate them on something nice that has happened to them or on something good that they have done.

example.ex: The club also offers its congratulations to D. Brown on his appointment as president.
example.tran: 俱乐部也对D.布朗被任命为主席表示祝贺。

means.word_mean: 1. an expression of approval and commendation;

sentences.sentence: "he always appreciated praise for his work"
